main_definition: Julia is a female name of Latin origin, typically used as both a given name and an adjective.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A popular Romanian first name for girls. In Romania, it is one of the most common names.
meanings_and_examples.example: Sofia was named Julia after her grandmother.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used to describe a girl or woman in an affectionate way, often used when referring to someone's childhood friend.
meanings_and_examples.example: My sister still refers to me as 'julia,' the nickname we had since we were kids.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In computing, a Julia language programming environment. It is an open-source system with dynamic typing and high performance in numerical computation.
meanings_and_examples.example: He decided to learn Julia for his next data science project because of its advanced array processing capabilities.
